item.title: Best South Korean Video Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • South Korea produces top-rated games in various genres, with MMORPGs like Lost Ark being standout successes globally.
  • DNF Duel and The Last Beserker: Khazan are part of the long-running Dungeon & Fighter series.
  • Lies of P and Stellar Blade provide some excellent combat and striking visual styles.

Video games have been very popular in South Korea since the 1970s, with Korean companies even getting involved in developing their own arcade games to critical acclaim, such as Air Buster , Hard Head , and Pollux . In more recent decades, developers have primarily focused on MMORPGs, many of which are incredibly popular in East Asia, including Lineage 2 and Cabal Online , which are still going strong after two decades on the market.

Like most countries, it's not all arcades and online multiplayer experiences, with some of the finest games across all genres coming from the peninsula, and a few indie gems too. These are some of the best games developed in South Korea, ranked based on a combination of their overall popularity and quality.

10 DNF Duel

Solid & Accessible Fighting Game

DNF Duel
Fighting
Systems
Released
June 28, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Arc System Works, Eighting, Neople
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Part of the long-running Dungeon & Fighters series of games, DNF Duel is among the best fighting games available on modern hardware. A 2.5D one-on-one fighting game, it is highly accessible to new players with simplified controls that can also appeal to more hardcore fighting game aficionados, rewarding those who master it.

The base game features 15 playable characters, plus the Lost Warrior, who can be unlocked by beating the story mode, and there are five combatants available as DLC. The story is serviceable, but the main selling points are the stunning visuals, fast-paced action, and the distinctive roster of fighters.

DNF Duel was co-developed by companies based in both Japan and South Korea.

9 Lobotomy Corporation

Horror-Themed Roguelike Management Simulation

Lobotomy Corporation | Monster Management Simulation
8.0 /10
Released
April 9, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Set in a futuristic dystopian society inspired by Lovecraftian horror, Lobotomy Corporation is a game that wears many hats. Playing as the manager of the eponymous organization, the main goal is to order employees to harvest energy from monsters, known as "Abnormalities" in the game, meeting a sufficient quota each day.

New employees can be hired as the facilities expand, though each Anomaly must be handled in its unique way, since they do not enjoy being locked in containment fields and can wreak havoc if they escape. The disturbing story is fairly deep and plays out in visual novel form, usually appearing at the end of another day of monster management.

8 Lost Ark

Popular MMORPG With Excellent Combat

Lost Ark
4.5 /10
Released
December 4, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Smilegate RPG
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

One of South Korea's many MMORPGs, Lost Ark is incredibly popular on both Eastern and Western shores, often ranking among the most played games on Steam. A PvE game with elements of PvP, it features multiple classes and advanced classes for players to select and develop, with constant updates providing additional options regularly.

One of the crowning features of the game is its combat, which emphasizes combos and provides some very satisfying animations when sweeping foes aside. The deep skill tree and variations in classes allow for high levels of player freedom when it comes to finding a combat style that suits their personal tastes.

7 Kingdom Under Fire: The Crusaders

Classic Xbox Tactical Wargame

  • Platforms : PC, Xbox
  • Released : 2004-10-12
  • Developer : Phantagram
  • Genre : Hack and slash, real-time strategy

Initially an exclusive title on the original Xbox, Kingdom Under Fire: The Crusaders possesses very similar gameplay to the Dynasty Warriors series, but with RTS and role-playing elements. Set in the high-fantasy Kingdom of Bersia, and with an iconic heavy metal soundtrack, this cult classic is a deep and tactical wargame.

The main character can be used to charge into battle, hacking and slashing through hordes of soldiers like a musou game, but other units can be commanded and controlled via the minimap or on a large battlefield overview in real time. 2020 PC ports allow players to enjoy some of the Kingdom Under Fire games all over again, but with some quality-of-life improvements for modern sensibilities.

6 Stellar Blade

High-Octane Action Game With Thrilling Boss Battles

Stellar Blade
9 /10
40
9.0 /10
Released
April 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature
Developer(s)
Shift Up
Platform(s)
PC, PS5
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Despite the discourse surrounding the revealing costumes and seemingly suggestive nature of the protagonist Eve, Stellar Blade contains a captivating narrative and some excellent, high-octane combat. Set in a post-apocalyptic future where humans have been banished from Earth by monstrosities known as the Naytibas, Eve must assemble her squad to reclaim their home planet.

Enemy designs are some of the best in video games, not only in terms of appearance but also in their attack patterns and the precise timing required to defeat them. At the Korean Game Awards in 2024, Stellar Blade achieved a clean sweep, earning seven award wins.

5 The First Berserker: Khazan

Fast-Paced Soulslike Action

The First Berserker: Khazan
18
8.4 /10
Released
March 27, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Neople
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Set in the same universe as the Dungeon & Fighter series, The First Berserker: Khazan is an action role-playing game with combat akin to that of the Souls series. The titular Khazan was a general of the Pell Los Empire, but has been exiled and branded a traitor, so he seeks to clear his name and exact revenge against those who wronged him.

Gameplay is based around a mission structure, and each level culminates in a battle with one of the formidable bosses. As a soulslike, falling in battle is inevitable, so mastering the high-speed combat system, managing Khazan's stamina, and capitalizing when enemies have low stamina themselves are critical to success.

4 DJMax Respect V

Rhythm Game With Plenty Of Game Modes & Online Functionality

DJMax Respect V
Music
Rhythm
Systems
Released
March 11, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Neowiz
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Part of the DJMax rhythm game series that largely found success domestically on handheld consoles, DJ Max Respect found global success on the PlayStation 4 and was later ported to PC and Xbox with the V release. There are hundreds of tracks to test those rhythmic abilities across multiple game modes, from arcade and freestyle to competitive online battles.

The V port even features extra songs and game modes for players to sink their teeth into. A diverse array of genres and plenty of renowned artists are featured in the track listings, so anyone who is a fan of rhythm games should find something that they can enjoy about DJMax Respect .

3 Lies Of P

Pinocchio, But A Soulslike Game

Lies of P
8 /10
20
9.2 /10
Released
September 19, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Round8 Studio, Neowiz
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Everybody knows the story of the puppet Pinocchio, but it is reimagined into a grim tale in the soulslike Lies of P . Combat is a tough prospect, but it is well-balanced and fair, rewarding those who learn its intricacies and make good choices when combining their skill tree upgrades with corresponding equipment.

The city of Krat is twisted by the uprising of puppets and the spread of a petrification disease plaguing its citizens. When not engaging in conflict with the various horrors that lurk in Krat, P must make choices when encountering various NPCs, deciding whether to tell the truth or lie, and this impacts the story going forward.

2 PUBG: Battlegrounds

Thrilling Battle Royale That Popularized The Genre

PUBG: Battlegrounds
23
7.1 /10
Released
March 23, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
PUBG Corporation
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, PC, Stadia, Android, iOS
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Originally conceived by Brendan Greene, an Irish game developer who is better known as PlayerUnknown, South Korean company Krafton invited him to join their team and develop PUBG: Battlegrounds . Though it was not the first battle royale game on the market, it was arguably the title that popularized the genre.

The gameplay loop is simple: dropping onto an island with an ever-decreasing safe zone and being the last person or team to survive, which often leads to thrilling shootouts with rival players. Sadly, there have been issues with cheaters since the game's inception, but the developers are constantly implementing new measures to combat this, and the game remains easy to pick up but very difficult to put down.

1 Dave The Diver

Explore The Ocean & Manage A Restaurant

Dave the Diver
9.3 /10
Released
June 28, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Blood
Developer(s)
Mintrocket
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Taking inspiration from a restaurant owner in Jeju Island, Dave the Diver is a hit indie game where players control the eponymous Dave as he catches fish to serve in his sushi restaurant in the evening. The Blue Hole is a deep ocean brimming with mysteries, and Dave can unlock new tools to assist in his exploration later in the game, bringing home more exotic treasures each time.

The wacky characters make each night managing the restaurant just as much of an adventure as searching the ocean for its secrets. Overall, it is a wholesome and unique experience with an unconventional narrative and satisfying gameplay loop.

item.title: Best RPGs Where You Can Combine Classes
item.description:
Summary

  • Combining classes in RPGs offers strategic depth, build opportunities, and replayability.
  • Games like Cyberpunk 2077 and Skyrim provide unique skill systems that allow players to craft their own classes.
  • Baldur's Gate 3 utilizes classes to the maximum degree, with the roles changing the story, gameplay, and outcomes of events.

Classes are essential to the identity of RPGs , as they require players to choose a role or job that fits their playstyle for the adventures that lie ahead. One of the most intriguing aspects of this design philosophy is the ability to combine different character classes and even create entirely new ones.

This mechanic goes beyond simple specialization, creating unmatched strategic depth, a variety of build opportunities, and significant replayability. It enables players to develop truly unique and synergistic archetypes. This mechanic has been featured in numerous RPGs over the years, ranging from classic action RPGs to expansive open-world games, each offering distinctive ways to combine classes. These are the best examples of RPGs where players can combine character classes.

Kingdoms Of Amalur: Re-Reckoning

The Perfect Game For Fans Of Battlemages

Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning
7 /10
8.0 /10
Released
September 8, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning is based almost entirely around the idea of mixing melee and magic-based classes for simple yet fun action-oriented combat. A sword can be imbued with any form of element or magic, creating even more damaging effects amid battle, with skills from multiple classes available to be added to the character.

Skills in Kingdoms of Amalur can also be distributed to the three trees of Might, Finesse, and Sorcery, with no limit to what can be unlocked. This varied combination of classes results in what are known as Destinies, which further diversify the gameplay. Suddenly, behemoth-sized boss fights can feel like a walk in the park if the player utilizes the classes properly.

Tiny Tina's Wonderlands

The Borderlands Spin-Off Fantasy Fans Have To Try

Tiny Tina's Wonderlands
6 /10
8.3 /10
Released
March 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Crude, Humor, Language, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Borderlands helped redefine first-person shooter RPGs, and the series spin-off, Tiny Tina’s Wonderlands , goes even further by being both a tribute to and parody of classic RPGs. In addition to one of the six already outlandish classes available from the start, the game allows players to choose a second class as they progress, creating wild combinations of powers that change every playthrough.

Tiny Tina’s Wonderlands is also very accessible as an RPG since it is still a Borderlands game, and at the end of the day, most of the game is spent shooting everything in sight. It’s short and relatively easy to pick up, but that never detracts from the fun factor, especially with the constant references and parodies of other fantasy RPGs.

Cyberpunk 2077

Cybernetic Augments Can Be Used To Create Varied Classes

6 Images
6 Images
Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
115
9.0 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Gamers can live out their fantasy of being a powerful cyborg in Cyberpunk 2077 , resulting in a sci-fi RPG that had a controversial launch but was updated and refined into a modern classic. It doesn't feature a traditional class system, but instead allows gamers to apply skill points to the areas that they want to focus on as a criminal in Night City.

If someone wants to focus purely on stealth and hacking, that can be done. If they prefer to be more aggressive with an emphasis on first-person shooter action and powerful cybernetic attacks, that is also viable. However, Cyberpunk 2077 also allows the player to turn the protagonist, V, into the ultimate cyborg and allocate skill points across all skill trees.

Grim Dawn

Saving The World From Demons Requires More Than One Class

Grim Dawn
9.0 /10
Released
February 25, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Violence, Blood and Gore, Sexual Themes, Language
Powered by

Fans of Diablo can transition to Grim Dawn with ease, as it presents nearly identical gameplay as an isometric action RPG and was even considered an upgrade from the initially disappointing release of Diablo 3 . After choosing a class, Grim Dawn offers an expansive adventure with the main protagonist slaying gothic monsters and undead to save the world.

Where Grim Dawn excels over its more famous counterpart is with its class system. Players start with one class, but after reaching level 10, they must choose a second class, known as a Mastery. This allows for even more customization, which, combined with the addictive gameplay, makes Grim Dawn a strong indie RPG that became a surprise success.

Pillars Of Eternity 2: Deadfire

Multiple Classes Are A Core Aspect Of The Series

Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire
8.8 /10
Released
May 8, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Blending the worlds of swashbuckling pirates and classic high fantasy, Pillars Of Eternity 2: Deadfire is another game with the same perspective as the Diablo franchise, but with a much greater focus on RPG systems. With an isometric perspective and battling legions of enemies to grow stronger, it takes a familiar concept and expands on it to create a game that rivals, if not surpasses, the competition.

Multiclass gameplay is a core feature of Pillars of Eternity 2 , where creating a character forces the player to choose two classes, allowing for extensive experimentation with every playthrough. Each class also has a subclass that can further alter gameplay as the character levels up, not only making them stronger but also creating unique class combinations unlike most RPGs.

Avowed

An Open-World Adventure In The Pillars Of Eternity Universe

13 Images
13 Images
Avowed
7 /10
39
7.5 /10
Released
February 18, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

There are only three main classes in Avowed : Fighter, Wizard, and Ranger, but the developers at Obsidian Entertainment allow players to spend points on attributes from all three. Avowed allows for arguably one of the strongest examples of a battlemage in the genre, able to wield a fighter’s sword with elite prowess while unleashing magical beams of devastating energy.

Avowed takes the player across the world of Eora, creating a shared gaming universe with the Pillars of Eternity series. Instead of an isometric perspective, it takes on a first-person view similar to The Elder Scrolls series, allowing for an even more immersive experience as the player fights pirate orcs and explores a rich and luxurious open world.

Final Fantasy 12: The Zodiac Age

The License Board Was Unlike Any Other Final Fantasy Job System

Final Fantasy 12
8.8 /10
Released
October 31, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Alcohol Reference, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Square Enix has never been afraid to experiment and stray from the norm when it comes to RPG systems in their iconic Final Fantasy series, and Final Fantasy 12: The Zodiac Age is a prime example. Every character is introduced as one particular class, but the License Board system allows for extensive class customization.

An archer like Fran can be the most powerful mage in the game, a warrior like Vaan can wield a spear while having the abilities and perks of a monk, and Penelo can be a white mage and a machinist all at once. Combined with the Gambit system, the License Board results in some of the most creative uses of classes in most RPGs, and they have turned Final Fantasy 12 into an undeniable classic.

Baldur’s Gate 3

Looks And Feels Like A Digital Dungeons & Dragons Campaign

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
141
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Similar to Tiny Tina’s Wonderlands , Baldur’s Gate 3 offers base classes, but after leveling up, the option to add another class becomes available to all players. Choosing classes is not only important for combat in the world of Dungeons & Dragons , but in dialogue interactions and events, as certain classes can only unlock or guarantee specific outcomes.

In many ways, Baldur's Gate 3 is the most committed to the concept of a role-playing game, making it feel like an actual campaign from the Dungeons & Dragons tabletop RPG. Everything is based on dice rolls, which are also affected by the player's chosen classes, resulting in a Game of the Year winner that became a definitive RPG of the modern era.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Every Skill Tree Is Available For The Dragonborn

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
81
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

While there is a main story to follow, Bethesda went all out in giving the player an impressive amount of freedom in The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim , from the quests to creating a class. Instead of just one class to choose from at the start, the player has access to every weapon, magic spell, and attribute via the constellation skill tree system, which levels up anytime the player does anything correlated.

Wielding a two-handed weapon in Skyrim can transform the Dragonborn protagonist into a Barbarian-like class. However, players can also choose to cast fireballs and develop a heavy battlemage playstyle. With sufficient time and dedication, players can upgrade every skill tree to become proficient in all weapon types and magic featured in the game.

item.title: Fortnite Survey Hints at Possible Future Crew Benefits
item.description:
The Fortnite Crew Pack membership could be getting a few upgrades, according to a recent survey, and the list looks quite promising. Fortnite has a lot of content for players to enjoy. Updates are released every two weeks with fun new features and weapons. Skins and fun cosmetics come out on a daily basis, whether they rotate into the Item Shop, are given as quest rewards, or as part of an event. The main modes – Battle Royale, Fortnite OG, Fortnite Festival, and LEGO Fortnite – have their own Battle Pass that players can purchase and complete.

While the game is free, many of these features require V-Bucks, Fortnite 's currency. Even if players have saved up V-Bucks over time from leveling up the Battle Pass, it can get pretty expensive, especially if players like to shop for in-game cosmetics. One of the best ways to have access to a lot of the additional content in Fortnite and earn 1,000 V-Bucks every month is to get the Crew Pack, a subscription that provides goodies on a monthly basis.

New Fortnite Crew Pack Features Teased in Survey

Many fans would argue that the Crew Pack is a great deal for those who play Fortnite regularly, and it seems that it could get even better soon. In a recent survey, Epic Games asked Fortnite players which features would be appealing to them if they were added to the Crew Pack benefits. The list consists of basic stuff, such as more cosmetics, to awesome, almost shocking, benefits, like being able to claim previously unclaimed Battle Pass cosmetics.

If players were given a chance to unlock cosmetics and styles from previous Battle Passes, the number of active Crew Pack subscriptions would undoubtedly rise. Even if this was exclusive to passes that the players previously owned, it would still capture fans' attention, as it'd give them the opportunity to claim high tier skins or secret skins that they weren't able to unlock, as well as Super Styles that they might've missed out on, as these are some of the hardest rewards available in the Battle Pass.

Another teased possibility was the Crew Pack being bundled up with another subscription service. With the recent collabs between Epic Games and Disney, they could sell the Crew Pack alongside a month of Disney+ for example. It is unknown if any of these features will ever see the light of day, but it's good to know that Epic Games wants to continue to improve Fortnite 's monthly subscription to ensure that players believe it to be worth the price.

Your comment has not been saved

WHERE TO PLAY

Create, play, and battle with friends for free in Fortnite. Be the last player standing in Battle Royale and Zero Build, experience a concert or live event, or discover over a million creator made games, including racing, parkour, zombie survival, and more. Each Fortnite island has an individual age rating so you can find the one that's right for you and your friends.

Explore large, destructible environments where no two games are ever the same. Team up with friends by sprinting, climbing and smashing your way to earn your Victory Royale, whether you choose to build up in Fortnite Battle Royale or go no-builds in Fortnite Zero Build.

Discover even more ways to play across thousands of creator-made game genres: adventure, roleplay, survival and more. Or, band together with up to three friends to fend off hordes of monsters in Save the World.

item.title: Best Games That Are Good For Your Brain
item.description:
Summary

  • Engaging puzzle games like Blue Prince and Catherine keep players' brains active and satisfied.
  • Super Hexagon and Tetris challenge players to develop split-second reactions and strategic thinking.
  • Portal 2 and Sifu offer satisfying puzzle-solving experiences that condition players' brains to respond instantly and thoughtfully to challenges.

Most video games stimulate the brain as players learn the ropes. This is all well and good, but there are times when the monotonous and easy nature of most modern games gets to players once they understand how to make the most of the gameplay loop.

This is why games that constantly keep the player's neurons firing, let them solve clever puzzles, and let them enjoy a sense of satisfaction after circumventing tricky challenges are great for a player's brain. It keeps them active and engaged throughout a spellbinding experience that fans will have a great time with.

1 Blue Prince

Players Will Slowly Learn How The Game Works And Eventually Reach Room 46

Blue Prince
19
9.1 /10
Released
April 10, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone // Alcohol Reference
Powered by

The roguelike puzzling of Blue Prince can definitely lead to a bit of frustration at times. Relying on RNG to solve puzzles isn't the greatest way to tackle this genre, but it's the excellent storytelling and wondrous sense of discovery that more than makes up for Blue Prince 's faults.

Players will slowly understand how to figure out the best way to reach the antechamber, unlocking the game's central mysteries as they finally find their way inside Room 46. It makes for a beautiful and satisfying experience, and the various other puzzles in the game ensure that a player's brain will remain active even after completing the game's central goal.

2 Furi

Pattern Memorization Is A Must In A Boss Rush Game That Prioritizes Quality Over Quantity

Furi
Arcade
Shooter
Systems
8 /10

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

A boss rush game may be an odd pick for something good for the brain, especially if players fail against a particularly challenging boss over and over again and become frustrated. However, this is just a part of the learning experience for Furi , where the limited number of bosses means that players are encouraged to recognize patterns and improve their split-second reactions.

This allows them to eventually get a read on bosses, figure out the best time to parry, and ensure that all their actions are carried out optimally. All of this combines to help Furi stand out as an incredibly stimulating action game that lets players enjoy a great dose of serotonin after defeating a particularly challenging boss, especially on Furier difficulty.

3 Catherine

Players Will Never Feel So Invested In A Game About Block Puzzles

Catherine
9 /10
8.0 /10
Released
July 26, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

Catherine is one of the odder games made by Atlus, which served as a test run of a new engine that would be used for Persona 5 and various other games. Vincent's amorous adventure forms the narrative crux of this game, but it's the dreams that lead to some truly headscratching puzzles.

Players are in a race against the clock as they try to ascend a block tower without being devoured by supernatural forces. The game is way harder than players would assume, forcing them to rack their brains in every segment to ensure that their way to the top isn't too challenging to deal with.

4 Super Hexagon

The Game Is Almost Hypnotic As Players Slowly But Surely Train Their Brain To Respond In The Blink Of An Eye

Super Hexagon
Action
Systems
Released
August 31, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

At a glance, Super Hexagon may seem like a game too simple for most players to get into. Guiding a small triangle through what is essentially a geometric obstacle course may not seem like the best way to utilize a player's brain, until they realize how this title helps players develop split-second reactions in its many levels.

From struggling at the simple "Hard" stage to eventually conquering the final "Hardestestest" level, players will be in a trance as they memorize each potential obstacle for each stage and put their reaction times to the test. It's a deceptively simple game that will keep a player's brain engaged as they struggle to survive for a minute in each stage without tearing their hair out.

5 VVVVVV

A Hard-As-Nails Platformer Where A Player's Brain Eventually Goes On Autopilot As They Circumvent These Challenges

VVVVVV
10.0 /10
Released
September 7, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Challenging platformers require players to use a combination of brains and skill to circumvent obstacles, and VVVVVV is no exception. The open-ended structure of this game promotes exploration as players rescue crew members and seek out an escape from a dimension they're trapped in.

Instead of jumping, VVVVVV uses the novel gameplay mechanic of gravity-flipping to let players traverse hazardous stages. Later levels add new elements to keep things fresh and ensure that a player's brain is firing on all cylinders as they figure out the best way to tackle the many platforming challenges.

6 Sifu

The Repetition Of This Game Conditions A Player's Brain To Respond Instantly To Enemy Attacks

Sifu
9 /10
9.2 /10
Released
February 8, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Sifu is a hard-as-nails game where players may get frustrated after reaching the Club, Museum, or pretty much any level following the Squats. Combat is unflinchingly hard and punishes players for not reading opponents and button-mashing.

Instead, players must be smart about how they approach combat encounters, using special skills and the environment to their advantage. A player's brain will be active every step of the way as they figure out the best approach to tackle tough combat encounters and challenging bosses, eventually leading to a sense of deep, profound satisfaction as they manage to complete the game and earn the privilege of going through it a second or third time while schooling bosses that were giving them a hard time, at first.

7 Tetris

The Quintessential Brain-Training Game With A Simple, Universally Recognized Gameplay Loop

Tetris (1984)
Puzzle
Systems
9.5 /10
Released
June 6, 1984
ESRB
E

Powered by

A legendary video game that needs no introduction, Tetris doesn't need a complicated gameplay loop to wow fans. Instead, the simple mechanics of placing blocks and forming lines are so tantalizing that players will be seeking out the best way to reach the highest scores as much as they can.

It's a simple puzzle that will keep a player's brain active as they slowly become more adept. Every version of Tetris has its unique additions to keep the gameplay fresh, but there's something about the original that will keep a player's brain stimulated as they get absorbed by a game that has no business being so tantalizing to play through.

8 Portal 2

Figuring Out Solutions To The Game's Ingenious Problems Is A Blast

Portal 2
10 /10
11
9.3 /10
Released
April 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

Players who want their puzzle games to be as charming and hilarious as they come will love what Portal 2 brings to the table. The scope of this sequel is expanded considerably and ensures that players will love solving the many head-scratching puzzles that come their way.

The entertaining dialogue ensures that a player's brain will be both engaged and satisfied as the sheer joy of this game infects them. The co-op campaign is a cherry on top of this amazing experience that allows players to enjoy this stimulating puzzle title with a friend.

item.title: Roblox Reveals Massive Daily User Count
item.description:
Roblox recently shared its staggeringly high count for the gaming platform's daily active users, with over 100 million players logging onto the game every single day. Roblox has long been one of the most well-known names within the gaming industry, with the gaming platform serving as a hub for players and game creators for nearly 20 years. The game creation platform has seen plenty of success stories among its many game experiences throughout its history, reaching some particularly historic highs in recent months. Now, Roblox is sharing just how massive the game has become.

Though Roblox has been giving fans the chance to create their own games since 2006, some of its most notable successes have come throughout the last year. Many games like Blox Fruits , Grow a Garden , and Dress to Impress have amassed impressive player counts, with Grow a Garden in particular seeing a massive boost during 2025. The Roblox farming simulator became so popular that its peak player counts even managed to eclipse Fortnite , boasting more than 21 million players on Grow a Garden . A new report now reveals the true extent of Roblox 's remarkable recent player counts.

Roblox Has Over 100 Million Daily Active Users

As reported by Eurogamer, Roblox shared its unprecedented player counts during the recent Roblox Developers Conference. A report shared by the Roblox Corporation revealed that Roblox currently sees an average of 111.8 million players logging into the game every single day, with an astonishing 390 billion visits to its games. Roblox even revealed the significant sum of money that has been earned by the game's creators, with over $1 billion USD brought in through the game creation platform. Roblox also shared that its pay rates to its in-game creators will be rising in the near future.

Roblox 's overwhelming success was joined by a pair of major announcements for the game platform during the Roblox -centric convention. Roblox Corporation revealed a brand-new type of content coming to the game platform, with "Moments" serving as a shortform-video feed within Roblox showing off different fan-made games. The developer also revealed it will be investing more into artificial intelligence in Roblox moving forward, hinting at features like creating in-game assets using AI prompts and improved text-to-speech engines.

Roblox 's staggering growth throughout 2025 has not come without its fair share of controversy as well. Alongside many other gaming platforms, Roblox recently pushed out new age verification software, in response to growing claims and even a lawsuit against Roblox suggesting that the developer does not do a sufficient job of protecting children. The claims come after Roblox CEO David Baszucki made the controversial suggestion that Roblox may eventually support dating features and include more adult-oriented games. Roblox 's recent controversies have seemingly done little to slow the game's meteoric rise as Roblox continues to break new ground.
